intro: Leucobotrys pilosa, commonly known as the hairy leucobotrys, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, white or yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Leucobotrys pilosa is often found in shaded, moist habitats such as forests or shrublands.
